Trends to watch:

Bullish
* Younger bands (say 3m-6m) start to decline as older bands (6m-12m) swell instead = maturing
* Older waves continue swelling = HODLing

Bearish
* Old or Middle waves decline rapidly
* Young waves swelling rapidly
Both suggest spending/distribution

~fin

Summary:

Older coins demonstrating higher conviction to hold coins through volatility.

Middle aged coins are the most in stress, and swelling of both bands is bullish, declining is bearish.

Young coins are declining, suggesting early phase accumulation/HODLing is in play
5/6

Young Coins < 3m

These waves will spike as old coins are distributed and change hands to newer buyers, and decline when accumulation is in play

#Bitcoin Active Supply charts provide insight into the proportion of $BTC supply older than 1yr.

'Peak HODL' is reached where the volume of 1yr+ supply hits a maximum, often near last cycles ATH.

After this, old coins are typically spent in bull markets as HODLers take profits. https://t.co/axHaXXE50E

$BTC coins mature into older lifespan brackets when they remain unspent.

7/ We are also working on further documentation to transparently communicate our processes, how we handle data and assure its quality.

We have a fiduciary duty to all of our clients and customers which we take very seriously.
 
For further questions kindly contact us directly.

6/ On-chain data analysis is dynamic and can be subject to change according to labels and statistical information.
 
If data/labels change, we report this ‚Äì as always ‚Äì in our changelog (https://t.co/Y5E3A8au7R), and we'll explicitly highlight resulting metric differences.

5/ It is at the core of our philosophy to optimize for very high precision and reduce false positives.
 
Hence we are conservative with labelling addresses and reporting of data points that are outside the essence of the metric at hand ‚Äì context is key.

4/ This is a cluster identified by us as a large financial service provider that uses Gemini as custodial.

We explicitly treat them in the in/outflow metrics as part of the extended cluster (internal) ‚Äì and not funds that are being deposited to be traded on the spot exchange.

3/ Yesterday‚Äôs event of algorithmically inferring the transaction as in-house was driven by multiple attributes of the cluster in question, among them:
 
- Recurring significantly large transactions
- High percentage of txs with Gemini
- Cluster balance pattern (‚Äúsawtooth‚Äù) https://t.co/3yYy3bm9Gz

2/ We have automated QA systems in place that are triggered and prevent the initial propagation of potential misleading information.
 
This prevents many false positives, e.g. when exchanges create new wallets and reshuffle funds.

1/ Addressing yesterday‚Äôs exchange data ‚Äì we remain with our statement.
 
The transactions in question were not external user deposits into Gemini's cluster.
 
This is in accordance with our address labels and clustering information.
